messages.message:
Hi there, qq re https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-4085

The idea behind the proposed fix is to send an URL with parameter passed as runId (camelCase)
However other parts of our app expect it as a parameter formatted in snake_case, e.g.:
https://https--demetr-sand2-instabase.instabase.site.sandboxes.run/workspaces/deploy/runs?run_id=5334b769-efa4-49ab-a247-2e750f72c374

my question is:
Do we have any agreement on the parameter format? (If we do, we potentially may want to fix our web client as well)

Based on what I see right now most of places has camelCase, e.g. "My workspace" view take a filter in camelCase:
https://https--demetr-sand2-instabase.instabase.site.sandboxes.run/workspaces/review/documents?workspace=d[â€¦]Id=5334b769-efa4-49ab-a247-2e750f72c374 (https://https--demetr-sand2-instabase.instabase.site.sandboxes.run/workspaces/review/documents?workspace=demetr.starshov_instabase.com&runId=5334b769-efa4-49ab-a247-2e750f72c374)
also based on what Serena said I assume that all views will be changed anyway (so no UI fix is needed rn), but I wanted to check if we have any agreement re this

oof i agree this is quite confusing :disappointed:

unfortunately some pages take in `run_id` as a query parameter, and some pages take in `runId`

in this case, for https://aihub.instabase.com/review?runId={id}, this really should be `runId`

see how https://aihub.instabase.com/review?runId=6ae498eb-5488-427a-97aa-355927ba49f9c (ss2) corresponds with https://aihub.instabase.com/review/6ae498eb-5488-427a-97aa-355927ba49f9 (ss1)

but https://aihub.instabase.com/review?run_id=6ae498eb-5488-427a-97aa-355927ba49f9 (ss3) results in something completely different :yikes:
